column4: You can use "apt-mark" to save a list of installed packages and dependencies, then once the new install is ready, use "apt-mark" again to load the list of packages and then install them
See the answer to this question for how to use it. http://askubuntu.com/questions/101931/restoring-all-data-from-backup-of-dpkg-set-selections
After installing the new system and running "apt-mark..." to select the packages, you do "sudo apt-get -f install" to have the selections installed
